event.name: Introduction to Drones
event.summaryHTML: Have you ever wondered how a drone could help your business? Do you know the difference between a quadcopter and a fixed wing?
event.descriptionHTML:
Have you ever wondered how a drone could help your business? Do you know the difference between a quadcopter and a fixed wing?

This workshop will cover:

  • Explanation of the differences between various drone platforms. Which one would suit your business needs?
  • A brief overview of the legalities of drones (PFCO license holder vs hobbyist) and the Drone Code.
  • Discussing drones/unmanned aerial vehicle’s (UAV’s) and their possibilities of application when using
    • photography and videography for insurance, sales and marketing
    • crop and livestock control
    • GIS
    • boundary mapping
  • Simulation of flying a drone as well as powering up and controlling the camera.
  • Signposting to further information.
  • The future of drones and what may be possible.

 

Eligible registered Farming Connect businesses can book a place at one of our workshops. Further information on eligibility can be found here.
 

For further information regarding the workshop, please contact the Service Centre on 08456 000 813.

event.name: Beginners Welsh
event.summaryHTML: This beginners course is ideally suited for people who have no Welsh language skills, or very little. By the end of the ten-week course, learners will be able to hold a basic conversation, both face to face and on the phone, with a sympathetic Welsh speaker.
event.descriptionHTML:
This beginners course is ideally suited for people who have no Welsh language skills, or very little. By the end of the ten-week course, learners will be able to hold a basic conversation, both face to face and on the phone, with a sympathetic Welsh speaker.

Content

Course content will include:

  • Greetings
  • Courtesies
  • Answering the phone (including the important phrase “I have recently started to learn to speak Welsh”)
  • Days of the week
  • The time
  • Simple questions and answers in the present tense

event.name: WLBP Farm Records Facility Workshops
event.summaryHTML: Welsh Lamb and Beef Producers Ltd is a farmer co-operative that manages a number of farm assurance schemes for the promotion of Welsh Lamb and Beef.
event.descriptionHTML:
Welsh Lamb and Beef Producers Ltd is a farmer co-operative that manages a number of farm assurance schemes for the promotion of Welsh Lamb and Beef. If you are a WLBP member via one of the assurance schemes you can access and use the online Farm Records and Animal Health Plan facility.

The Farm Records and Animal Health Plan is a tool designed to assist WLBP members to maintain accurate and up to date records of animal management. This includes a sheep flock book, cattle herd register and medicine purchase and treatment record.

The Farm Records and Animal Health plan facility is available to all producers in the WLBP lamb, beef (FAWL) scheme, dairy schemes and the Welsh Organic scheme.

Please ensure you are Farming Connect registered before booking on to this event

event.descriptionHTML:

event.name: Lambing Losses Part 1 – Abortion and Nutrition
event.summaryHTML: Workshop attendees will learn about the main causes of lamb loss prior to lambing; abortion, nutritional imbalance and prolapses.
event.descriptionHTML:
Workshop attendees will learn about the main causes of lamb loss prior to lambing; abortion, nutritional imbalance and prolapses. The focus will be on the transmission and diagnosis of Enzootic abortion (EAE) and Toxoplasmosis (the main causes of abortion in the UK), and the biosecurity and biocontainment measures that can be taken to minimise losses as a result of these infections. The workshop will also outline the importance of body condition scoring and correct nutrition in minimising losses due to metabolic disease, prolapses and dystocia.

 

Prevention of infectious abortion, correct nutrition and monitoring of pregnant ewes will result in increased flock health, productivity and profitability.

event.name: “Advanced Bid Writing – A winner’s guide to producing top tenders.”
event.summaryHTML: Join bid writing specialist Jamie Edwards from TenderWrite for a fact filled training session on how to take your bid writing skills to the next level. Are you tendering to the public and private sector? This course is for you!
event.descriptionHTML:
Join bid writing specialist Jamie Edwards from TenderWrite for a fact filled training session on how to take your bid writing skills to the next level. Are you tendering to the public and private sector? This course is for you!

Funded by Business Wales, this new course will give you fresh insight and clear practical guidance on how to:

  • Making sure your company is ‘bid ready’ when opportunities are there
  • How to be a better ‘Bid Manager’ within your business
  • Understanding how to create winning bid content in your responses
  • Managing the feedback process to build better bids
  • Understanding how to bid for international opportunities as well as UK ones
  • Practical workshop-style exercises on evaluating and developing winning bids

Jamie is a professional bid writer with a long history of writing successful bids for a variety of companies in highly diverse industries, from construction, civil engineering through to facilities management, healthcare and recruitment.

This course is not about the basics of tendering. It’s ideally suited to those who have tendered previously but are frustrated at a lack of success or who simply don’t know how to develop their bid content to a higher standard for better results. It’s a relaxed, workshop style course with a mix of presentation, group discussion and practical exercise on the day. If you are not sure where you are going wrong or how to improve – this course will give you the clear insight need on how to raise your game in a hugely competitive process.

 

** Please note, we are unable to accept the following: **

No more than 1 delegate per business at this event

No Businesses with more than 250 Employees (SME’S Only)

** If you are living outside of Wales but are intending to set up a business in Wales, you will be accepted onto our Workshops **

event.name: TEST2 Lambing Losses Part 2: Post-Lambing Losses from Birth to Weaning
event.summaryHTML: Workshop attendees will learn about the main causes of lamb loss from birth to weaning, and the management strategies that may be employed to minimise these losses.
event.descriptionHTML:
Workshop attendees will learn about the main causes of lamb loss from birth to weaning, and the management strategies that may be employed to minimise these losses. The main focus will be on the perinatal period, including managing ewe nutrition to reduce dystocia and increase lamb vitality. Improving hygiene during the lambing period is also vital to reduce the risk of lamb losses due to infection. Discussion about biosecurity and biocontainment will highlight areas where improvements may be made to minimise the risk of disease introduction and spread on farm.

 

Prevention of infectious disease, correct ewe nutrition and monitoring of neonatal lambs will result in increased flock health, productivity and profitability.

event.name: Level 3 Award in Education and Training
event.summaryHTML: The Level 3 Award in Education and Training is an introduction to teaching that will give an insight into the roles, responsibilities and relationships in education and training, how to plan and deliver inclusive teaching sessions and how to assess and give constructive feedback. This is ideal for learners who are just beginning to undertake short training sessions.
event.descriptionHTML:
The Level 3 Award in Education and Training is an introduction to teaching that will give an insight into the roles, responsibilities and relationships in education and training, how to plan and deliver inclusive teaching sessions and how to assess and give constructive feedback.

This is ideal for learners who are just beginning to undertake short training sessions. This qualification can also help you to progress in teaching/training and support roles in a wide range of organisations in the lifelong learning sector.

Content - During the five day course you will cover the following areas:

• Understanding Roles, Responsibilities and Relationships in Education and Training

• Understanding and Using Inclusive Teaching and Learning Approaches in Education and Training

• Understanding Assessment in Education and Training

event.name: Research & planning your marketing activity
event.summaryHTML: This workshop takes you through the market research process, helps you identify the questions you need answers to, explains where to get information and which techniques to use and shows you how to use your findings to make better decisions.
event.descriptionHTML:
This workshop takes you through the market research process, helps you identify the questions you need answers to, explains where to get information and which techniques to use and shows you how to use your findings to make better decisions.

By the end of this session you will:

  • Understand why market research is so important
  • Be clear about what market research you need to do
  • Know where to find information and which techniques to use
  • Know the market and your competitors
  • Understand your customers
  • Able to undertake your own market research
  • Have a step by step process to develop a marketing plan
  • Know how to price your product and services to maximise profits
  • Understand the basics of successful selling
  • Be able to put a plan in place to get your first customer

 

To book your place, call 01656 868500.

venue.descriptionHTML: Newport is only two hours away from London via the M4, while other motorways and dual carriages connect Newport with the North, Midlands, South East and South West England and West Wales. Both campuses are signposted from the M4. There are a number of council-owned multi-storey car parks situated around the City Campus. The postcode is NP20 2BP.

venue.name: University of South Wales - Exchange (Brecon Building)
venue.descriptionHTML:
ÔªøDirections to Treforest Campus:

From the M4, exit at J32 and join the A470 north towards Merthyr Tydfil and Pontypridd. After about 6 miles, you will see signs for the A473 (Llantrisant) and the University of South Wales. Take the first exit off the roundabout, across the bridge. Turn left, then stay left, following the signs to the University.

If you’re approaching the University south-bound from the A470, follow the A470 to Pontypridd and take the A4223 exit toward Pontypridd. At the roundabout, take the 3rd exit onto the A470/A4058 ramp and stay in the right-hand lane taking the 3rd exit (A4058) at the next roundabout before turning left onto the Broadway/A473. Stay on the A473 following signs up to the University.

Our open-air visitor’s car park is situated on Llantwit Road facing the University. Pay and display parking is in operation (£1 for up to 5 hours and £2 for all day) with tickets needing to be validated at the red pay booth before exit.

USW Exchange is located on the lower floor of Brecon Building. An accessible route is available by coming down the sloped path on the right side of Brecon Building, keep right onto the patio area and you will see Exchange’s entrance.

If you need any help locating us on the day give us a call on 01443 482266.

event.name: Managing your Finance & Tax
event.summaryHTML: This workshop aims to provide information to support you with personal and capital allowances, simple tax and NI calculations and self-assessment. We answer the question “Why is bookkeeping important?”, and how to keep records to ensure you have control of your business transactions. This is a practical workshop and enables you to feel confident and understand the reasons why tax and good bookkeeping are essential and sound business practice.
event.descriptionHTML:
This workshop aims to provide information to support you with personal and capital allowances, simple tax and NI calculations and self-assessment. We answer the question “Why is bookkeeping important?”, and how to keep records to ensure you have control of your business transactions. This is a practical workshop and enables you to feel confident and understand the reasons why tax and good bookkeeping are essential and sound business practice.

This workshop will also look at the key elements of running the money side of your business. It introduces the basic financial statements, shows you how a Profit and Loss Account and balance sheet are put together and explains cash-flow statements. In short, it helps you understand enough of the detail to take control of your business.

By the end of this module you will:

  • Understand the basic financial statements for your business
  • Be able to put together a profit and loss account and read a balance sheet
  • Know how to complete a cash-flow forecast and use it to keep track of your finances
  • Understand the different ways to forecast sales
  • Be able to prepare a set of figures for your business to manage your finances effectively

The planned introduction of digital tax will also be discussed and how to ensure you are not left confused by the changes to submitting returns. The presentation will explain what digital tax is, how and why it is being introduced.

 

To book your place, call 01656 868500.

 

This workshop is ideal for self-employed or small trading businesses with under 5 employees

event.name: Personal Development Plan (PDP) Workshops
event.summaryHTML: Personal Development Plan (PDP) workshops are available to help you identify your objectives and decide which new skills will help you meet your goals.
event.descriptionHTML:
Creating a Personal Development Plan (PDP) can help:

  • Set long term objectives and short term goals
  • Identify ways of developing key skills or competencies
  • Provide you with information on training courses
  • Record current qualifications and skills
  • You can review your PDP at regular intervals to monitor progress and achievements
  • The PDP is the baseline and starting point for your Continuous Professional Developments (CPD) record. 

 

Eligible registered Farming Connect businesses can book an appointment at one of our workshops. Further information on eligibility can be found here.

event.name: Social Media Workshops
event.summaryHTML: Does your business need a promotional boost? Are you looking to diversify? Social media marketing could help.
event.descriptionHTML:
Does your business need a promotional boost? Are you looking to diversify? Social media marketing could help.

In this workshop we focus on 5 potential social media networks which could be used to engage with potential customers, showing you how each one works in different ways. 

As part of the session, we will discuss how social media can work in conjunction with other digital marketing techniques and explain and demystify some low cost social media advertising strategies that all small businesses should be using, but most don’t because they think they are too complicated. 

You will leave with fresh ideas to fine tune your social media more efficiently, leaving you more time to work in your business!

 

Eligible registered Farming Connect businesses can book a place at one of our workshops. Further information on eligibility can be found here.
 

Please note that spaces are limited to 50 per workshop, on a first come first served basis.
  

For further information regarding the workshop, please contact the Service Centre on 08456 000 813.

event.name: Starting and Running a Business - Taking the Plunge
event.summaryHTML: This workshop will help you understand what is required to start a business and will help you assess whether you have what it takes to be a success.
event.descriptionHTML:
This workshop will help you understand what is required to start a business and will help you assess whether you have what it takes to be a success.

By the end of this session you will:

  • understand the pros and cons of being your own boss
  • be able to assess your personal skills
  • be clear about the legal aspects of starting a business
  • understand the key tasks needed to start a business
  • know how to put a basic business plan in place
  • know where to get advice and source finance for your business

To book your place, call 01656 868500.

Take the first exit off the roundabout, across the bridge. Turn left, then stay left, following the signs to the University.

If you’re approaching the University south-bound from the A470, follow the A470 to Pontypridd and take the A4223 exit toward Pontypridd. event.name: Starting and Running a Business - Taking The Plunge 2020
event.summaryHTML:
Ever wondered what it takes to start your own business? Have you got an idea that you want to turn into a fully-fledged start-up?

Our start-up workshops, delivered by experienced advisers, who have run successful businesses themselves, provide knowledge and understanding of the fundamental aspects and challenges of starting and running a business.
event.descriptionHTML:
Ever wondered what it takes to start your own business? Have you got an idea that you want to turn into a fully-fledged start-up?

Our start-up workshops, delivered by experienced advisers, provide knowledge and understanding of the fundamental aspects and challenges of starting and running a business.

The course will take you through the key stages of business and financial planning, and will help you to:
- Understand the pros and cons of self-employment
- Assess your personal skills and capabilities
- Find out where to get advice and source finance
- Understand the legal aspects of setting up a business

You will also have the opportunity to meet other like-minded entrepreneurs at the beginning of their business journey, helping you to get the inspiration, confidence and motivation to start up.

event.name: Starting a Growth Business
event.summaryHTML:
Have you ever wanted to start and grow your own business?

Will you be employing staff?  Do you need to find premises?  Do you need to find finance? … these are some of the key aspects of starting a Growth Business.

Would you benefit from fully funded expert business support to start your growth journey?

 

Starting a Growth Business

Starting a business can be rewarding and invigorating, but it can also be risky and challenging. According to Stats Wales the survival rate for start-ups is low with 12% failing in the first year, furthermore 40% fail to reach their 4th anniversary however recent research indicates that Business Wales funded support increases the likelihood of a start up reaching a 4-year milestone to 85%!
event.descriptionHTML:
Have you ever wanted to start and grow your own business?

Will you be employing staff?  Do you need to find premises?  Do you need to find finance? … these are some of the key aspects of starting a Growth Business.

Would you benefit from fully funded expert business support to start your growth journey?

 

Starting a Growth Business

Starting a business can be rewarding and invigorating, but it can also be risky and challenging. According to Stats Wales the survival rate for start-ups is low with 12% failing in the first year, furthermore 40% fail to reach their 4th anniversary however recent research indicates that Business Wales funded support increases the likelihood of a start up reaching a 4-year milestone to 85%!

“Starting a growth business” … is an introductory workshop, designed for individuals who aspire to start. Designed and delivered by a team of skilled and experienced business advisers – this fully funded workshop covers the vital elements necessary for successfully starting your growth business.

This is the first in a series of practical workshops that will equip you with the essential tools, theory, knowledge and insights to help you design your own business growth plan.

Over the duration of the workshop you will learn:

  • How to develop your business idea
  • Learn why some businesses fail
  • How to start your market research
  • How to develop your strategic business plan
  • How to start developing a marketing plan and strategy
  • About legal structures for your new business
  • About Unique Selling Points – USP’s
  • About basic business taxes for your new business
  • How to develop the financial viability of your new business
  • What funding/financing opportunities exist for your new business
  • How to plan for long term growth in your new business
  • How to identify potential barriers to growth

You will also benefit from:

  • Follow on, funded 1-2-1 Support from a Growth Adviser
  • A Growth Business Plan Template
  • A Cashflow template
  • A Workshop workbook
At the end of the BW workshop you take away the skills, knowledge and strategic tools to enable you to develop a successful pre-start plan and convert this into a successful start to your new business venture. 

To book your place, call 01656 868500.

event.name: Sheep Parasite Control – Roundworm & Blowfly Workshop
event.summaryHTML: Workshop attendees will learn about the lifecycle and clinical signs associated with the main species of roundworm in the UK as well as blowfly strike.
event.descriptionHTML:
Workshop attendees will learn about the lifecycle and clinical signs associated with the main species of roundworm in the UK as well as blowfly strike. The main focus will be on control of these parasites, responsible use of anthelmintics and the importance of veterinary consultation in formulating a parasite control plan for individual farms. Correct and efficient parasite control will result in increased flock health, productivity and profitability.

event.name: Reducing Mastitis In Dairy Cattle
event.summaryHTML: Workshop attendees will have the opportunity to increase knowledge on the causes, detection, monitoring, treatment and prevention of clinical and sub-clinical mastitis in dairy cows.
event.descriptionHTML:
Workshop attendees will have the opportunity to increase knowledge on the causes, detection, monitoring, treatment and prevention of clinical and sub-clinical mastitis in dairy cows. This will include discussion on methods to detect and monitor mastitis, identification of risk factors in the cows’ environment and milking parlour and biosecurity and biocontainment measures required to prevent mastitis pathogens entering and spreading within herds. 
 
Booking is essential.

event.name: Superfast Business Wales - How to run your tourism business online
event.summaryHTML: 72% of Welsh SMEs use at least one form of digital. Find out how you can build your online presence, win new customers, save money, and grow your tourism business online at this fully-funded workshop.
event.descriptionHTML:
72% of Welsh SMEs use at least one form of digital. Find out how you can build your online presence, win new customers, save money, and grow your tourism business online at this fully-funded workshop.

 

You will learn:

  • How to save money and increase profits
  • How to target new customers and build your brand with social media
  • How to work smarter with mobile and flexible working
  • How you can build better customer relationships
  • How to write web content that stands out from the crowd
  • How digital marketing tools help engage your target market

 

Included in this workshop:

  • Overview of digital tools for tourism businesses
  • OTAs (Online Travel Agencies) & booking systems
  • Social Media; Facebook, Twitter, Instagram
  • Facebook & Instagram Adverts
  • Email marketing
  • Basic image & video creation/editing for your online marketing
  • Office 365 / Google & other cloud tools
  • CRM systems
  • Online invoicing & accounting
  • Using TripAdvisor & other review sites to your advantage

 

97% of attendees said our courses were beneficial to their business

 

“Very enjoyable and informative”

“Excellent, very informative and helpful”

 

This workshop is part of a package of free support from Superfast Business Wales specifically for trading Welsh SMEs.

What we will deliver:

  • Free business workshops: learn practical ways to make the most of online tools and technologies for quick wins and big improvements
  • Tailored 1:1 support: get a one-to-one advice session with a Digital Business Adviser to talk about your business needs and receive a custom-made plan
  • Website review: get a free review of your website to find areas you could improve to increase your online visibility and customer awareness

 

Register for this free event now! Or book direct on 03332 408329
event.specialConditionsHTML:
Are you eligible for our support? You can double check here or confirm on 03332 408329 or superfast@businesswales.org.uk

What will you need to know?

We want as many companies in Wales as possible to learn how online technology can help them strengthen their business. So, we need to be fair and limit the number of Superfast Business Wales events you and one other colleague can attend to one. Don’t worry if there are a range of topics you’d like to know about as your business adviser will be able to cover these.  Once you’ve registered your interest, an Online Adviser will call you to confirm your place at the event.

If you aren’t currently trading or can’t meet the service level criteria please feel free to read our case studies and guides; or why not use our e-learning tools here or visit Business Wales to explore other support that could be available for you.

event.name: Understanding Johne’s Disease Workshop
event.summaryHTML: Workshop attendees will learn about the clinical signs, transmission and diagnosis/monitoring of Johne’s disease.
event.descriptionHTML:
Workshop attendees will learn about the clinical signs, transmission and diagnosis/monitoring of Johne’s disease. The main focus will be on biosecurity and biocontainment strategies that can be implemented in consultation with their veterinary surgeon to minimise the risk of Johne’s disease being introduced into a naïve herd, or to reduce the spread of disease if it is already present on farm.

Prevention of introduction and spread of Johne’s disease will result in increased herd health, productivity and profitability.

event.name: Marketing for Small Businesses and Start-ups
event.summaryHTML: This workshop is ideal for anyone who would like to develop their knowledge and understanding of basic marketing principles. It’s suitable for individuals thinking about starting their own business or who have already started a business. Everyone is welcome at the Hub.
event.descriptionHTML:
Are you looking for marketing ideas? Do you need help to create a marketing plan for your business?

Join us at Carmarthen Enterprise Hub for an interactive two hour marketing session to support business start-ups and small businesses. Come and join local business owners and like-minded individuals who are in the process of launching a business to learn and share your ideas.

What will we cover?

Our informal workshop will cover the basic principles of marketing, including:

  • Overview of marketing
  • Your objectives and customer needs
  • Create a mini plan
  • Marketing mix ideas and tactics
  • Digital marketing
  • Free online tools
  • Customer experience
  • Measure what’s working

The workshop will offer practical advice and ideas for you to take away. You will have the opportunity to start plotting your own mini marketing plan.

Who is this workshop for?

This workshop is ideal for anyone who would like to develop their knowledge and understanding of basic marketing principles. It’s suitable for individuals thinking about starting their own business or who have already started a business. Everyone is welcome at the Hub.

About the Speaker

After spending 14 years in the insurance and financial services sector as a Head of Marketing, Gwenllian is now enjoying working with local entrepreneurs at Focus Carmarthen Enterprise Hub. She works with a number of local businesses supporting their marketing plans and campaigns. Gwenllian will be on hand to offer practical advice and tips on how to market you and your business.

Speak to the Hub Team

The hub team will be available throughout the session for you to discuss your ideas and help take the next step. Book your place today!

We encourage you to attend 20 mins prior to the start of the session in order to fill in a small amount of paperwork and to network with others.

Light refreshments will be provided.

event.name: How to Tender - An Introduction.
event.summaryHTML: This free session is for any business interested in winning more public sector tenders. We’ll show you how to tap into the estimated £4.3 billion spent by the public sector in Wales. We’ll share invaluable insights into the process, rules and regulations you need to follow.
event.descriptionHTML:
This free session is for any business interested in winning more public sector tenders. We’ll show you how to tap into the estimated £4.3 billion spent by the public sector in Wales. We’ll share invaluable insights into the process, rules and regulations you need to follow.

We’ll focus on:

  • Understanding the procurement process
  • Increasing your chance of success when tendering
  • Utilising the Sell 2 Wales procurement portal
  • Responding to the procurer’s pre-qualification questionnaire (PQQ) or tender questions and requirements.
  • Communicating your experience, track record and expertise.

Once finished, you’ll know if you’re ready to tender, what you need to add, as well as the resources and support that’s available.

Attendees should be advised to bring a laptop/tablet to the workshop, along with their Sell2Wales log in details.

This workshop begins with an introduction to Business Wales and a 30 minute practical session about environmental & HR policies to help your company enhance your tendering bids.

 

To book your place, call 01656 868500.

 

** Please note, we are unable to accept the following: **

No more than 1 delegate per business at this event

No Businesses with more than 250 Employees (SME’S Only)

** If you are living outside of Wales but are intending to set up a business in Wales, you will be accepted onto our Workshops **

event.name: Introduction to Digital Marketing
event.summaryHTML: Our Introduction to Digital Marketing course draws on our experience teaching CIM/CAM Digital Marketing courses and 1-day workshops. This intensive 1-day course will provide you with both the theoretical and practical skills to start planning digital marketing campaigns within your own organisation. You will leave the course with your own digital marketing plan template.
event.descriptionHTML:
Who should attend?

This course is designed for those who want to get a better understanding of digital marketing. It is ideal for those who are new to marketing or those who want to make sure that they are approaching digital marketing correctly and using the right tools.

Learning Outcomes

On completion of this 1-day course you will:

  • Understand how to develop a Digital Marketing Plan
  • Know how SEO works and the role content plays
  • Have a clear understanding of the mani social media networks and how to use them
  • Understand the role advertising and email plays
  • Have learnt about Google Analytics and the importance of measurement

Course Outline

The Digital Environment

  • What is Digital Marketing?
  • Characteristics of Digital Marketing
  • Difference between digital and traditional marketing
  • Customer expectations
  • Online Customer Journey

Developing a Digital Marketing Plan

  • Introduction to PR Smith's SOSTAC® Planning Framework
  • Carrying out an audit
  • Identifying objectives and developing a strategy
  • Implementing tactics
  • The importance of measurement

Website Design

  • Website objectives
  • Types of website
  • Aspects of website design
  • Websites and devices
  • Websites and Google

SEO and Content

  • What is SEO?
  • Why is it important?
  • What does Google look for?
  • Developing links
  • The importance of content marketing
  • Google Local and Search Console

Social Media

  • The Social Media landscape
  • Social Media fundamentals
  • Different options for Social Media
  • Exploration of Facebook, Twitter and Instagram
  • What about Pinterest and Blogging?

Online Advertising and Email

  • What is online advertising?
  • Google Ads for Search
  • Google Ads for Display
  • Paid advertising on Social Media
  • What is email and how should we use it?
  • Creating goals and lists
  • Preparing campaigns and measurement

Measuring Digital Marketing

  • What is Google Analytics?
  • What are metrics?
  • Measuring success/failure in GA
  • Key elements of GA
  • Creating Goals
  • Reporting
  • Recap and QA.

Who delivers the course?

Our Introduction to Digital Marketing course is delivered by tutors who have years of experience delivering both CIM courses and 1-day workshops. They understand the needs of digital marketing learners and also have many years of industry experience as digital marketing practitioners.

Cost

Delegates rates for Cardiff courses start from £225 (+VAT) and for London £325 per person and include:

  • Course material
  • One hour 1-to-1 session by Zoom to discuss your specific needs after the course
  • Access to a password-protected Google Analytics blog which features videos, articles, podcasts, videocasts, PowerPoint slides, book links and more.
  • Lunch and refreshments throughout the day

Discount

  • Get 10% off course bookings if your organisation is a registered charity (not applicable to Early Bird discounts).
  • If you have 2 or more staff attending, we can offer a discount (off the Standard NOT Early Bird rate).

Times

Courses start at 9.00 am, though we ask delegates to arrive at the venue between 8.45 - 9.00. The courses end at 4.30 pm and lunch is usually taken at 12.30 pm with tea and coffee breaks mid morning and mid afternoon. To work out your travel times, please see the venue addresses below. If you have any dietary requirements, please let us know.

event.name: Marketing, the Whole Picture

Business Wales – Creating a Marketing Plan for your Start Up Business.

Thinking of starting a business? Help start with us and create your marketing plan!

Marketing is a lot more than communication, it’s about communicating the right message.

Marketing is a lot more than communication, it’s about communicating the right message. In this informative workshop we will help you look at the broader marketing picture and help you to start thinking about the power of content and the USP along with the latest developments in Social Media and online selling.

 

You will learn:

  • How to create a marketing plan.
  • How to research and identify your target audience.

  • How to create a marketing campaign.
  • How to promote your products and services on Social Media.

event.name: Sheep Parasite Control 2 - Sheep Scab, Lice & Liver Fluke
event.summaryHTML: Workshop attendees will learn about the current situation with Sheep Scab including the welfare and economic impact.
event.descriptionHTML:
Workshop attendees will learn about the current situation with Sheep Scab including the welfare and economic impact. The lifecycles and clinical signs associated with Sheep Scab, Lice, and Liver Fluke are covered. The main focus will be on effective biosecurity, appropriate treatment options and the importance of veterinary consultation for diagnostics and to formulate parasite control plans for individual farms. The risks from common grazing and treatment resistance will be highlighted.

event.name: Startup Club
event.summaryHTML:
Are you thinking it could be time for a career change? 

It’s a new year, which of course means a new Startup Club. This is our 9th group in Wrexham after opening our doors in 2018 and supporting over 100 businesses through Startup Club.
event.descriptionHTML:
Are you thinking it could be time for a career change? 

It’s a new year, which of course means a new Startup Club. This is our 9th group in Wrexham after opening our doors in 2018 and supporting over 100 businesses through Startup Club.

 

Setting up your own business & being self employed is a dream for a lot of people but knowing where to start and how to sustain can be a daunting prospect. 

Our 11 week, fully funded course will introduce you to an expert speaker each week, they will cover all of the topics essential for setting up as self employed, from business plans, digital marketing, presentation skills and more!

 

The best part is that you won’t be doing it alone, every week you’ll be alongside a group of like minded individuals who are all at different stages of the same journey. 

Right when you think it can’t get any better, we’ve got catering covered with food, tea & coffee!

 

Limited spaces, be sure to book quickly!

event.name: Social Media Course
event.summaryHTML: Social Media Marketing can seem like a daunting and overwhelming prospect. This beginner-intermediate course will demystify the subject and give you a clear understanding of how your organisation can effectively use social media for engaging, promoting, listening and much more. We have over 10 years' experience and have delivered to more than 800+ students  from 100's of companies.
event.descriptionHTML:
Course Programme

Social Media Fundamentals

This session looks at the key planning methodology SOSTAC and key concepts of Social Media, including the following:

  • SOSTAC - developing a Social media strategy
  • Social Media stats & facts
  • Key elements of Social media
  • SEO and Social media

Twitter
Twitter is one of the most cost-effective, real-time social networks out there. We will look at how Twitter works, how organisations use it and how you can use it to its full potential.

  • What is it and how are organisations using it?
  • What and how do you use elements like retweets, replies, hashtags, lists, etc?
  • How to build and nurture a following.
  • How to monitor, research and listen?
  • 3rd party applications and analytics.

Facebook
Facebook has 2 billion monthly active users and 30 million pages are updated by businesses daily. So, how can your organisation make the most of this social media channel?

  • What are Facebook pages and how do organisations use them?
  • Understanding the Facebook interface.
  • Explore techniques to create great updates
  • Discover tools and tips for adding images to Facebook
  • Exploring Facebook Analytics and ads

Blogging
Blogging has been used by both private & public sector, government and education since around 2002. But what value do they have in 2018?

  • How are companies using blogs?
  • Understanding how blogs work and how companies are using them.
  • Blog ambassadors, blog strategies,  editorial calendars & embedding content.
  • Considering writing strategies for blogs.

Video and Image Sharing
Kim Kardashian and Justin Bieber might have the biggest Instagram accounts but how are organisations using these platforms to engage audiences and reach new prospects?

  • Exploring the channels - YouTube, Instagram and Pinterest.
  • How are they being used by organisations?
  • Categorising media - how to guides, PR, FAQ's, testimonials, product previews, etc
  • How to make your content more findable.
  • Creating and embedding content and the role of user generated content.

LinkedIn
LinkedIn is the biggest Professional Networking site in the world. This section explores how individuals and organisations can harness its power to build connections and connect to customers.

  • Creating high quality LinkedIn profiles.
  • Developing connections and recommendations.
  • How to use LinkedIn Publishing.
  • Using LinkedIn groups for yourself and your business.
  • How to create and develop company pages.

Like most 1-day courses the Social Media course is non-accredited; however, to see our accredited courses visit this page.

Cost

The cost of the course is £195 (£234 inc VAT), though early-bird discounts can apply of £175 (£210 in VAT). The cost includes:

  • Course materials
  • Full access to our online knowledge centre with useful documents and links

Discount

  • Get 10% off course bookings if your organisation is a registered charity (not applicable to Early Bird pricing).
  • If you have 2 or more staff attending we can offer a discount (not applicable to Early Bird pricing).

event.name: Introduction to the Event Management System
event.summaryHTML:
This online training session is for event organisers who wish to use the Event Management System (EMS) to promote their own events on the Business Events Finder. 

To participate on the training session you must have already been approved as an Event Organiser.
event.descriptionHTML:
This online training session is for event organisers who wish to use the Event Management System (EMS) to promote their own events on the Business Events Finder. 

To participate on the training session you must have already been approved as an Event Organiser.

The course will cover:

  • Security
  • Account management
  • Managing users
  • Options for using the EMS
  • Managing files
  • Creating venues and events
  • Moderation
  • Feedback
  • Booking information and reporting

The session lasts approximately 45 minutes and you will be asked to join a conference call and web conference.  An email confirming the joining details will be sent to you the day before the course.

You will need access to the internet to attend this course. You will be required to download a small piece of software prior to your webinar to view the conference.

If you have not already applied to use the Event Management System to promote your events, please complete the registration form and submit it to the Event Support Team before registering for a session.
event.specialConditionsHTML: Please do not register for this session unless you have already registered as an Event Organiser.

event.name: Introduction to Wordpress
event.summaryHTML: This course is aimed at complete beginners who have no prior experience with Wordpress, but want to get themselves setup with a website to promote their brand / business online.
event.descriptionHTML:
Through this course Alex Jeffers, Managing Director of Glue Studio LTD, will teach you how to setup your own Wordpress site, add themes, add plugins, configure the navigation and widgets and then get it live for the world to see.

Who is the workshop for?

This course is aimed at complete beginners who have no prior experience with Wordpress, but want to get themselves setup with a website to promote their brand / business online.

It is a practical course so a laptop will be required by all participants of the course so they can practise some of the things which are discussed.

What will the workshop cover?

The workshop will cover the following:

  • Introduction to Wordpress
  • How to get started with a site
  • Adding content
  • Themes and Plugins
  • Configuring Plugins
  • Widgets and Menus
  • Going live!

About the Speaker

Alex Jeffers is the managing director of Glue Digital Studio LTD, a web design and development agency based at Tramshed Tech in Cardiff. Alex has over 3 years’ experience building Wordpress websites and over 6 years’ experience maintaining them.

event.name: Business Pitching Masterclass
event.summaryHTML:
Pitching allows you to stand out from the crowd and get the right people excited about your business.

Pitching is an essential necessity for any business to thrive. Whether you are networking, seeking seed funding or delivering a pitch, excelling at pitching will make a huge difference to your business.

This workshop will help you build your pitching confidence and provide you with valuable tips for pitching your business.
event.descriptionHTML:
Big Ideas Wales helps young people in Wales who want a start a business and encourages entrepreneurial skills within all young people so that they can use those skills in whatever career they may choose. Big Ideas Wales is managed by the Youth Entrepreneurship Team within Welsh Government. 

Our events are free and open to any young person aged 16-25. Please note that numbers are limited and we expect demand for places to be high so we advise you to book early to secure a space.

If you are between 16-25 and are interested in starting a business you can also sign-up for ‘Big Ideas Unleashed’ to receive a free start-up guide, access to Simply Do Ideas, plus you can be referred for further business support from one of our business advisors. Sign up here. 

You can also sign up for the Big Ideas Wales Newsletter for start up stories, news and events here.

Pitching allows you to stand out from the crowd and get the right people excited about your business.

Pitching is an essential necessity for any business to thrive. Whether you are networking, seeking seed funding or delivering a pitch, excelling at pitching will make a huge difference to your business.

This workshop will help you build your pitching confidence and provide you with valuable tips for pitching your business.
event.specialConditionsHTML:
- You must be aged 16-25

- You must be thinking of starting a business or recently started

event.name: Superfast Business Wales - Win More Customers with a CRM
event.summaryHTML:
Using a CRM system could increase your sales by up to 29%.

The most successful companies look beyond winning customers and focus on retention, often using Customer Relationship Management system (CRM) to do the leg work for them. Find out how you can gain new customers and improve your relationship with existing ones by delivering a better and more personalised service at our fully-funded workshop.
event.descriptionHTML:
Using a CRM system could increase your sales by up to 29%.

The most successful companies look beyond winning customers and focus on retention, often using Customer Relationship Management system (CRM) to do the leg work for them. Find out how you can gain new customers and improve your relationship with existing ones by delivering a better and more personalised service at our fully-funded workshop. 

You will learn:

• Why you should invest in CRM

• How to win new customers

• Tips to grow customer loyalty

• Best practice for data protection

 

Thanks for dropping by. Is your business an SME based in Wales and currently trading and registered with Companies House or HMRC? If you answered yes, then read on or scroll down to book onto an event in your area:

What we will deliver? 

  • Free business workshops: learn practical ways to make the most of online tools and technologies for quick wins and big improvements
  • Tailored 1:1 support: get a one-to-one advice session with a Digital Business Adviser to talk about your business needs and receive a custom-made plan
  • Website review: get a free review of your website to find areas you could improve to increase your online visibility and customer awareness

Register for this free event now!

Or book direct on 03332 408329
event.specialConditionsHTML:
Are you eligible for our support? You can double check here or confirm on 03332 408329 or superfast@businesswales.org.uk

What will you need to know?

We want as many companies in Wales as possible to learn how online technology can help them strengthen their business. So, we need to be fair and limit the number of Superfast Business Wales events you and one other colleague can attend to one. Don’t worry if there are a range of topics you’d like to know about as your business adviser will be able to cover these.  Once you’ve registered your interest, an Online Adviser will call you to confirm your place at the event.

If you aren’t currently trading or can’t meet the service level criteria please feel free to read our case studies and guides; or why not use our e-learning tools here or visit Business Wales to explore other support that could be available for you.

event.name: Google Ads (AdWords) Training Workshop
event.summaryHTML: Looking for an introduction to Google Ads or want to improve the performance of your current Google Ads account? We're here to help with our 4hr Google Ads training workshop.
event.descriptionHTML:
This course is perfect for Marketing Managers, Executives or Assistants as well as Business Owners and Entrepreneurs.

What will I learn?

  • How Google Adwords works
  • How to research the best keywords for your business
  • Goal setting
  • Account set up & structure
  • Keyword types (including negative keywords)
  • How to write compelling ads
  • The AdWords auction process
  • Bid strategies
  • Targeting, including location, device, demographic
  • Audience targeting, including Remarketing for search ads, in-market and detailed demographics
  • How to measure AdWords success in Analytics

Do I need to bring anything?

As the course is hands-on, you will need to bring a laptop and, if you already have an AdWords account, please ensure you are able to log into your account.

Stationary and refreshments will be provided.

Who will be delivering the course?

The course will be delivered by Alix Charles from Alix Digital – a PPC Specialist and an all-round marketing enthusiast. Alix has many years of knowledge and has worked in house, as a freelancer and for a number of top Welsh Digital Marketing agencies before setting up her own company. She has delivered a large number of digital marketing courses over the years with the aim of helping many companies learn, develop and grow.

Our testimonials

We are proud to have helped a large number of businesses learn more about Google Ads, here are some of the things our happy delegates have said:

“Worked with Alix for some bespoke Google AdWords training. She knows her stuff. Very reasonable and really beneficial. Thanks Alix”

Julie Walters – Business In Focus

“I completed the Google Adwords course with Alix. Would highly recommend this course very helpful, informative and hands-on. Alix is a very helpful, friendly, professional and knowledgeable. Thank you Alix!”

Amy – Pinpoint Manufacturing

“Alix really impressed me with the level of detail and content in her course. Alix really knows her stuff, she was able to quickly adapt her training to the level of those of us in the room to ensure that we understood what we were doing. Thank you for making this ‘black art’ so much more accessible to me.”

Anita Davies – Freedom From Tedium

event.name: Cobalt supplementation in the growing lamb
event.summaryHTML: To prevent cobalt deficiencies in livestock, especially in growing lambs, most farmers now use many different  methods of supplementing cobalt; from slow release boluses to injectable vitamin B12.
event.descriptionHTML:
To prevent cobalt deficiencies in livestock, especially in growing lambs, most farmers now use many different  methods of supplementing cobalt; from slow release boluses to injectable vitamin B12.

Join Farming Connect and South Wales Farm Vets for an up to date discussion on cobalt supplementation in the growing lamb. 

Using data from a recent local trial, come and see what may work on your farm. We will also have a brief refresher on the run-up to lambing and metabolic diseases of the ewe.

 

For more information please contact Elan Davies on 07985 379890 or elan.davies@menterabusnes.co.uk

event.name: ILM Level 3 Introduction to Leadership
event.summaryHTML:
Introduction to Leadership and Management programme is perfect for those who are new to management. This people focused qualification is designed to understand and develop management and leadership skills.

The Award level is ideal for candidates who have had little formal management training or who wish to refocus on their skills and techniques for building, managing and leading a team. As well as introducing learners to the various leadership styles it also covers how to motivate and empower your team through development of working relationships and effective delegation.
event.descriptionHTML:
Introduction to Leadership and Management programme is perfect for those who are new to management. This people focused qualification is designed to understand and develop management and leadership skills.

The Award level is ideal for candidates who have had little formal management training or who wish to refocus on their skills and techniques for building, managing and leading a team. As well as introducing learners to the various leadership styles it also covers how to motivate and empower your team through development of working relationships and effective delegation.

This programme includes a DiSC Work of Leaders personality profile  which will provide each delegate with a personalised report on their  leadership style.

The programme consists of four delivery days and key topics include leadership, developing excellent working relationships, organising and delegating effectively.

Units include:

308 Understanding Leadership

334 Understanding and Developing Relationships in the Workplace

319 Understanding Organising and Delegating in the Workplace

event.name: Advanced Imaging & Materials Characterisation
event.summaryHTML: This Course will shape your understanding of the principles of microscopy by exploring the subject from atoms to application.
event.descriptionHTML: The course will explore the theory and understanding of the methods that underpin a wide range of characterisation techniques. Practical implementation of this knowledge will be gained by using equipment within the Swansea University Advanced Imaging of Materials (AIM) department. The course will include: sample preparation techniques including metallography and ion beam milling, Carbon and metal coating, high quality imaging of metals and non metals, Light microscopy,Scanning electron microscopy, Energy dispersive electron spectroscopy for chemical composition analysis and Advanced post processing software.

event.name: Google Analytics Training
event.summaryHTML: Google Analytics is one of the most powerful and useful digital tools available to organisations. It helps you measure and improve your digital marketing efforts. Our Google Analytics course is designed to help you better understand the activities of your customers, potential customers and even competitors to and around your website.
event.descriptionHTML:
Modules covered on the day

Introduction to Analytics

  • What is Analytics and why do we use it?
  • Why is it beneficial to organisations?

Account Structure and Analytics Implementation

  • What are properties, views, dimensions and metrics?
  • Learn the key concepts: e,g. sessions, visitors and pageviews.
  • Considering and defining online goals (micro and macro goals).
  • Understanding filters.

Understanding the Analytics Interface

  • How to use the date and graph selector.
  • Learn to use primary and secondary dimension selectors.
  • Tips on how to use and understand reporting in tables.
  • Creating/emailing dashboards, widgets and reports.

Traffic Sources

  • Understanding where visitors come from.
  • Exploring your key channels.
  • Understanding where Google's Search console fits in.

Standard Reports

  • Dimensions and Metrics in standard reports.
  • What are the characteristics and reporting features of main reports:
    • Audience,
    • Acquisition
    • Behaviour

Standard Reports - Conversions

  • Aligning business and marketing objectives to Analytics.
  • Micro and Macro goals.
  • Events - tracking on-page events (pdf's, videos, links, etc)
  • Goal flow and visualisation.

Segments & Customisation

  • How to create segments.
  • Understanding & creating custom reports
  • How to set up custom alerts.

Recap

  • Review and recap.
  • Q & A.

Who is it aimed at?

This course is aimed at beginner to intermediate-level students, who have a basic understanding of what Google Analytics is but would like to further develop their knowledge. People from marketing, sales, customer care and the technical departments will all find this course of interest.

Brochure download

Download our Google Analytics (London) Brochure

Download our Google Analytics (Cardiff) Brochure

Cost

Delegates rates for Cardiff courses are £195 (+VAT) per person and include:

  • Course material
  • Access to a password-protected Google Analytics blog which features videos, articles, podcasts, videocasts, PowerPoint slides, book links and more.
  • Lunch and refreshments throughout the day

Discount

  • Get 10% off course bookings if your organisation is a registered charity (not applicable to Early Bird discounts).
  • If you have 2 or more staff attending, we can offer a discount (off the Standard NOT Early Bird rate).

Times

Courses start at 9.00 am, though we ask delegates to arrive at the venue between 8.45 - 9.00. The courses end at 4.30 pm and lunch is usually taken at 12.30 pm with tea and coffee breaks mid morning and mid afternoon. To work out your travel times, please see the venue addresses below. If you have any dietary requirements, please let us know.

Locations

Cardiff location (training)

Our principle training venue is Purbeck House, Cardiff Business Park. This location is situated between Junction 32 of the M4 and Cardiff Centre making it ideal for this travelling from Cardiff, Newport, the South West England, West Wales and the South Wales Valleys. Our CIM and CAM courses generally take place here, along with 1-day workshops.

Computers are NOT available at the Cardiff venue (please check with us beforehand to find out if you need to bring a laptop). We are able to provide laptops but would have to charge for this. However, there is complementary, fast wi-fi access available throughout the venue.

In-house courses

Should your organisation require, we can arrange to have the workshop delivered either at your location or a venue closer to your workplace. Check out our In-House page for more details.

Funding

For those who have been, or are about to be made redundant, you may well be eligible for funding from the Welsh Government ReAct Scheme. Visit our funding page to find out more information.

Book online today

To reserve a place, please complete our London or Cardiff booking forms.

* Discounts of 10% available off standard (not Early Bird) pricing for charities or for 2 or more people.

event.summaryHTML: Marketing Tom has teamed up with experienced mobile video trainer, Anna Brees, to deliver a Mobile Video for Social Media Marketing Workshop. event.name: Creating a Website
event.summaryHTML: This workshop is aimed at people who either wish to get a Website, or improve the one that they have and promote it online.
event.descriptionHTML:
This workshop is aimed at people who either wish to get a Website, or improve the one that they have and promote it online. A website needs to look good but also needs to be effective. This workshop will show you how.

 

This session will explain what is required to either build your own Website, or find a Web Developer to build it for you. You will learn how to pick the right domain name, Web hosting and what to look for in a good Website. You won’t be able to build a Website whilst on the course but there will be demonstrations of the best DIY options with tips on what to include.

 

Once your Website is built, you need to promote it. We explain in simple terms how to get listed on the search engines such as Google, and explore other options for getting customers to your Website such as email marketing, social media and link building.

 

Please note that spaces are limited to 20 per workshop, on a first come first served basis.

For further information regarding the workshop, please contact the Service Centre on 08456 000 813.

event.name: Skills Funding to Develop your Business
event.summaryHTML:
Are you looking to develop the leadership skills of your employees? Would you like to know what funding is available to improve skills within your business?

If the answer is YES to either of these questions, then find out more on Thursday 23rd January in the Bridge Innovation Centre, Pembroke between 8:15am – 10:00am. The Haven Waterway Enterprise Zone Business Interaction Group in partnership with Business Wales will be bringing you presentations from ION Leadership, and the Welsh Government Skills team.
event.descriptionHTML:
Are you looking to develop the leadership skills of your employees? Would you like to know what funding is available to improve skills within your business?

If the answer is YES to either of these questions, then find out more on Thursday 23rd January in the Bridge Innovation Centre, Pembroke between 8:15am – 10:00am. The Haven Waterway Enterprise Zone Business Interaction Group in partnership with Business Wales will be bringing you presentations from ION Leadership, and the Welsh Government Skills team. 

ION Leadership is specifically designed to help owners, directors, team leaders and managers working in the private and third sectors improve their skills, grow sustainable businesses and enrich the lives of their employees.

Results have shown that participation in leadership programmes can deliver:

  • a marked increase in turnover (26% on average)
  • creation of sustainable enterprises capable of continuous growth
  • better equipped business leaders with enhanced knowledge and skills
  • a supportive network of leaders that continue to meet, share ideas and do business with one another

In fact, an impressive 97% of delegates have reported a significant impact on them and the way in which they work.

The Welsh Government Skills team will be discussing the Flexible Skills Programme which provide 50% of eligible training costs in the following areas:

  • Advanced Digital Skills
  • Export Skills

If you are looking to improve the skills in your business, this is sure to be an event not to be missed. Book now as we anticipate places filling quickly.

event.name: CIM Certificate in Professional Marketing (Digital Marketing)
event.summaryHTML: The Chartered Institute of Marketing is the world's leading professional marketing body with over 28,000 members worldwide, including more than 3,000 Chartered Marketers. The aim of the CIM Level 4 Certificate in Professional Marketing is to provide the practicing marketer with relevant, contemporary marketing content to equip them for the current global landscape. Learning is brought to life through meaningful and active assessment methods which embrace the modern marketing industry. Successful completion of the CIM Level 4 Certificate in Professional Marketing will establish the knowledge, skills and understanding to be able to perform at an operational level and to carry out an essential and successful professional marketing role within the workplace.
event.descriptionHTML:
Qualification Structure

The CIM Level 4 Certificate in Professional Marketing comprises TWO mandatory modules: Marketing and Integrated Communications and ONE elective module: Digital Marketing to gain the full qualification. However, you can choose to complete just one module and gain an award. 

Bite-sized Awards

Each module can be achieved as a distinct, self-contained award which can be built up to attain the full foundation certificate. 

Marketing (mandatory) - The role and function of marketing in some depth, as well as what influences the behaviour of your customers. You will be able to apply and adapt a marketing mix to satisfy customer needs.

Integrated Communications (mandatory) - The many different ways of communicating with customers, both inside and outside the organisation.

And then you will have the choice of an elective:

Digital Marketing (elective) - How to apply practical knowledge, including the effective use of a digital marketing toolkit.

Who is it for?

The CIM Level 4 Certifcate in Professional Marketing is aimed at the aspiring professional marketer who wishes to gain knowledge and skills to succeed and progress with a career in marketing. Ideal for those working in marketing support roles (e.g. marketing assistants) or whose current job encompasses elements of marketing.

How will it benefit you?

  • Get a unique opportunity to blend practical skills with academic understanding
  • Improve your global competitive advantage, increase your confdence and employability
  • Keep up with the latest trends and stay ahead in your field
  • Invaluable opportunity to network with other marketers
  • CIM qualifcations are recognised by businesses all over the world

Entry criteria

One or more of the following is required to gain entry onto this qualifcation:

  • CIM Level 3 Foundation Certifcate in Marketing or any relevant Level 3 qualification
  • Any UK degree or international equivalent
  • International Baccalaureate (equivalent to NQF Level 3 and above)
  • Professional practice (suggested one year in a marketing role) plus diagnostic assessment onto Level 4
  • If English is not your frst language, English language qualifcation within the last two years

Assessment

  • A mixture of exam and assignments based on a given scenario and an organisation of your choice
  • Employer-driven, practitioner-based, relevant and appropriate for business needs
  • Three assessment sessions per year taking place in December, March/April and June/July

Ways to study

  • We differ to many organisations as we offer face-to-face study, with each module delivered over 2 days (during the week)
  • We also offer email and phone support after the course

Length of study

  • Each module will take 130 – 150 hours notional learning time
  • Notional learning time includes guided learning hours, practical and work-based learning, assessment preparation time, assessment time and supported self-study time

How much does it cost?

Our qualifications and bite-size awards represent a sound investment in your future and your employer may therefore be willing to sponsor you.

The cost of the CIM Professional Marketing (Digital) is £1500 (payable to the Study Centre). The CIM costs are £140 per assessment (3 in total) and a yearly fee of £55. You should allocate a £40-50 spend on books.

event.summaryHTML: Do you need to get more from your brand and marketing? Do you need to gain an advantage over your competitors? The course will explore branding within the world of small business and is designed to help business owners understand what creates a strong, clear brand image and how to apply a concise, compelling narrative to your marketing to engage new and inspire existing customers.

event.name: Starting a Social Enterprise
event.summaryHTML: Do you have an idea that puts passion before profit? Social Enterprises have the potential to change the fortune for local and even global issues leaving a lasting impact on people's lives.
event.descriptionHTML:
Do you have an idea that puts passion before profit? Social Enterprises have the potential to change the fortune for local and even global issues leaving a lasting impact on people's lives.

Social Business Wales have teamed up with The Wrexham Enterprise hub to provide a 6 week workshop, bringing you face to face with enterprising experts to ensure your business gets the best possible start.

 

1.      Identity – how you can use any business to achieve social good (looking at ideas and options)

2.      Strategy – what do you want to achieve? (focusing on your social & business mission and telling others)

3.      Engaging with stakeholders – who are they and how will you engage with them?

4.      Generating income and funding – (being financially sustainable, support out there & developing a strategy)

5.      Choosing the right structure – governance and legal models (structure only comes after strategy…)

6.      Standing on the shoulders of giants – short presentations and Q & A with social entrepreneurs

 

To ensure each business gets the right attention we have super limited spaces available so ensure to book your place early.

How to Build and Launch your Product like a pro

Tramshed Tech and Focus Newtown Enterprise Hub are pleased to invite you to a product development session with Baf Kurtulaj, Organiser of ProductTank Cardiff the largest tech community in the world and Founding partner of ProductLabs.

Who is this workshop for?

This workshop is for people with ideas! Individuals who do and do not have an existing business are welcome to attend this session. It will be aimed at non-technical entrepreneurs with viable ideas but, need a little guidance on where to start.

What will the workshop cover?

This workshop will help you to frame the problem you are trying to solve and support the development of a niche for your idea. Additional Information

Book your place today!

event.name: Spring Grazing in Autumn Calving Systems
event.summaryHTML: Andre Van Barneveld explains the principles and benefits of a good Spring Grazing plan with Bodysgaw Isa
event.descriptionHTML:
Andre Van Barneveld explains the principles and benefits of a good Spring Grazing plan with Bodysgaw Isa

How your platform is grazed during the Spring, will impact your quality of grazing throughout the rest of the year.

Having a good first round of grazing is crucial in setting up the farm to produce milk from grass profitably, throughout the year, whilst maintaining a good work-life balance for the farmer.

Join us for Bodysgaw Isa’s second meeting as a Strategic Dairy Farm with Andre Van Barneveld, of Graise Consultancy. Andre will talk us through the targets, red flags and importance of Spring grazing plans. After lunch we will learn about Bodysgaw Isa’s grazing plan and assess grass covers with a plate meter.

In the meeting we will discuss:

  • Managing grazing from calving through to magic day
  • Converting spring grass into profit
  • Measuring grass to manage grass
  • Grazing to conditions; having flexibility and bravery!
  • Maximizing response from fertilizer

 

Lunch provided so booking is essential. 

 

As this is a joint event with AHDB some data which you have supplied Farming Connect at registration will be shared with them. To understand more about how and why AHDB use your data, please visit the  AHDB website .

 

To book your place please contact KE Events Hub on 01904 771216 / ke.events@ahdb.org.uk or click here. For more information, please contact Richard Davies, AHDB on 07966 237841

 

Please bring a clean pair of wellington boots to help with the biosecurity.

If you have any special dietary requirements, please contact us as soon as possible.

event.name: Bovine Viral Diarrhoea (BVD) Workshop
event.summaryHTML: Workshop attendees will learn about the clinical signs, transmission, diagnosis and monitoring of BVD.
event.descriptionHTML:
Workshop attendees will learn about the clinical signs, transmission, diagnosis and monitoring of BVD. The main focus will be on the significance of Persistently Infected (PI) animals in disease transmission, and the biosecurity and biocontainment measures that can be taken to minimise the risk of BVD entering a naïve herd, and reduce the spread of disease already on farm.

Prevention of the introduction and spread of BVD will result in increased herd health, productivity and profitability.

 

Contact Vets directly to book your space - 
  • Carmarthen Veterinary Centre - 01267 220404

event.name: Reducing Dairy Cattle Lameness Workshop
event.summaryHTML: Workshop attendees will have the opportunity to increase knowledge on the causes, treatment and prevention of lameness in dairy cattle.
event.descriptionHTML:
Workshop attendees will have the opportunity to increase knowledge on the causes, treatment and prevention of lameness in dairy cattle. There will be an opportunity to learn about the infectious and non-infectious types of lameness in dairy cows.  The focus will be on ensuring awareness of the different causes of the various types of lameness and how they can require very different approaches for control.  The importance of mobility monitoring and prompt action or treatment will be emphasised.

Treatment protocols will be discussed, along with preventative measures to improve cow health, welfare and productivity.

Booking essential.

 

Contact Vets directly to book your space - 

  • Daleside Vets - 01978 311444
  • Farm First Veterinary Services - 01873 840167
  • Fenton Vets - 01437 762511
  • Priory Vets - 01239 612479

event.name: Making Tax Digital – The Options
event.summaryHTML: All farm and forestry businesses which have a taxable turnover that exceeds the VAT registration threshold of £85,000 per annum need to keep their records digitally, using Making Tax Digital (MTD) compatible software, from 1 April 2019 onwards.
event.descriptionHTML:
All farm and forestry businesses which have a taxable turnover that exceeds the VAT registration threshold of £85,000 per annum need to keep their records digitally, using Making Tax Digital (MTD) compatible software, from 1 April 2019 onwards.

The workshop will cover:

  • An overview of what the change will entail.
  • Demonstrations of a range of popular software packages.
  • Whether operating this software is something you can do yourself.

This workshop is suitable for all levels, whether you complete VAT online yourself or use an Accountant or Business Advisor to do this on your behalf.

Eligible registered Farming Connect businesses can book a place at one of our workshops.  Further information on eligibility can be found here.

 

Please note that spaces are limited to 20 per workshop, on a first come first served basis.

 

Further dates and venues will be made available.

 

For further information regarding the workshop, please contact the Service Centre on 08456 000813.

Managing performance can be complex and challenging, especially for new line managers. This programme supports new line managers in developing knowledge and understanding in how to manage performance in the workplace.

This programme enables learners to develop knowledge and understanding of conflict management and motivation theory and how it can be applied in the workplace to improve performance as required by a practising or potential first line manager.
event.descriptionHTML:
Managing performance can be complex and challenging, especially for new line managers. This programme supports new line managers in developing knowledge and understanding in how to manage performance in the workplace.

event.name: Tramshed Tech Express Programme
event.summaryHTML:
We are pleased to invite you onto the Tramshed Tech Express Programme. It is a twelve week programme covering all aspects of building a successful business.

The programme will run every Thursday from the 6th February to 23rd April and culminate in a real investor pitching panel.
event.descriptionHTML:
We are pleased to invite you onto the Tramshed Tech Express Programme. It is a twelve week programme covering all aspects of building a successful business.

Programme content:

Week 1: Introduction Session and Business Planning
Week 2: Idea Generation and Product Development
Week 3: Storytelling for Start ups
Week 4: Marketing and Sales Channels
Week 5: Digital Business Models
Week 6: Finance to start your business
Week 7: Finance to grow your business
Week 8: Protecting your business (IP, Data Protection and Cyber Security)
Week 9 (AM): Setting up as an international business
Week 9 (PM): How to build a successful leadership team
Week 10: High Productivity Business Operations
Week 11: Investing Pitching Panel
Week 12: Feedback and Outcomes Session

The days will be split as follows:
Workshop 1 - 10:30am-12:30pm
Case Study - 12:30pm-1:30pm
Workshop 2 - 2:30pm-4:30pm

The programme will run every Thursday from the 6th February to 23rd April and culminate in a real investor pitching panel.

To be eligible for the programme you must be an established, post-start company or a pre-start with a solid business idea ready to take the next step. Companies must be SMEs and all must have the potential for growth.

Acceptance on the programme will require a short, informal telephone call with Tramshed Tech to ensure the programme fits with the needs of the individual.

Throughout this programme, one to one coaching sessions are also available.

N.B. Although it’s a 12-week cycle, companies who are on the programme and don’t feel the need to sign up to the whole programme can attend individual sessions to help grow their businesses.

If you are interested in participating in the programme please register your interest on this page and we will be in touch or contact Jess Phillips - Enterprise Innovation Manager at Tramshed Tech for more information - jess@tramshedtech.co.uk

event.name: Cwm Ivy & Whiteford Sands: Freshwalks Netwalking Event
event.summaryHTML: Freshwalks helps you feel and perform better. In life and in business. It does this in five ways. Through an enhanced state of mental performance and wellbeing, improved physical fitness, collaboration with others, knowledge sharing and growing your network.
event.descriptionHTML:
Welcome to Freshwalks on the glorious Gower Peninsula. In association with Red Rock International, we warmly invite the business community of Swansea, Llanelli, Port Talbot and further afield to join us for a fabulous day of walking, talking and fresh air.

Whiteford Burrows and Sands, located at the most northern point of the Gower, gives walkers a feeling of wilderness unlike any other part of the Peninsula. A stunning combination of sandy beaches, pine forest, costal path and salt marsh provides great walking, wildlife spotting and head space.

Freshwalks help you feel and perform better. In life and in business. It does this in five ways:

  1. Enhanced state of mental performance and wellbeing
  2. Improved physical fitness
  3. Collaboration with others
  4. Knowledge sharing
  5. Growing your network.

Find out more about business benefits.

event.name: Basic Excel
event.summaryHTML: This one-day course is suited to delegates who need a formal introduction to Excel. The programme will allow learners to learn navigation around Excel and the basic functions. Each delegate will have a step by step workbook to bring back to the workplace for future reference.
event.descriptionHTML:
Course Overview

This one-day course is suited to delegates who need a formal introduction to Excel. The programme will allow learners to learn navigation around Excel and the basic functions.

Each delegate will have a step by step workbook to bring back to the workplace for future reference.

Content

• Spreadsheet structure, organisation, customisation and printing

• Using Templates, Group Mode, Filters and Formatting options

• Understanding the rules of B O D M A S, Mathematical Operators and Logical Operators

• Using basic Functions

• Writing Formulas, Autosum, Autofill and other symbols

• Understanding Relative and Absolute references

• Simple Charts
