event.name: Managing Sickness Absence & Return to Work Conversations
event.summaryHTML: What tools and strategies can we use for improving attendance at work?
event.descriptionHTML:
Sickness absence can have a major impact on productivity, profit and morale. This two-hour workshop looks at a range of strategies for reducing short-term absence, and for preventing short-term absence from slipping into longer term absence.

 

Our focus is on problem-solving, workload management, reasonable adjustments and positive promotion of wellbeing.

 

We look at how to have positive, honest and constructive conversations with your employees as they return to work after a period of absence, keeping a focus on solutions, adjustments and future planning for each individual.

event.name: Farming For The Future event
event.summaryHTML:
• Future proof your business
  • ‚ÄãAccess fully or part funded business and technical support
  • Start the Farm Business Grant (FBG) application process
event.descriptionHTML:
• Future proof your business
  • Access fully or part funded business and technical support
  • Start the Farm Business Grant (FBG) application process

 

Join us at one of these events for further information on the substantial level of services and support available for you.

There will also be a focus on the many ways in which Farming Connect can support the above, in particular through the Advisory Service, which can provide eligible businesses with up to four instances of advice.

 

IMPORTANT: Eligibility for the Welsh Government’s Farm Business Grant (FBG), which can provide a grant of between £3,000 and £12,000, requires a partner in the business to attend one ‘Farming for the Future’ event organised by Farming Connect. The individual attending must be registered as a business partner with Farming Connect and Welsh Government Rural Payment Wales. Farmers across Wales will be able to invest in around 70 items linked to animal health; genetics and performance; crop management; energy efficiency; resource efficiency and ICT.

If you wish to access the Farm Business Grant (FBG), attending a ‘Farming For The Future’ event is a mandatory requirement to express an interest in the scheme.

 

Doors open at each event for mandatory signing in at 7pm, the event will begin at 7.30. Booking in advance is essential.

 

Click here to view our Privacy Notice.

 

For more information please contact the Farming Connect Service Centre on 08456 000 813.

event.name: Equality & Diversity Awareness
event.summaryHTML:
Equality & Diversity at work is good for your employees and good for business. This free half day course helps managers, team leaders and employees from SME's to understand how investing time in Equality & Diversity can help:

  • Attract and retain the best quality employees 
  • Create more positive working relationships
  • Greater productivity within your team
  • Increased Performance
  • A more innovative and creative approach
  • Appeal to a wider audience (of customers)
  • Reducing the risk (and cost) of possible legal action
event.descriptionHTML:
This half day course aims to develop the learners understanding of what equality and diversity is, and how to promote it in the workplace.

 
It covers the Protected Characteristics and the different types of discrimination, increasing the learner's awareness and promoting a fair, tolerant and more diverse working environment.

What's Covered?

  • Understand what 'Equality and Diversity' means
  • Identify ways that people are different
  • Awareness of personal assumptions and attitudes
  • Protected characteristics
  • Types of discrimination

Delegates will be issued with certificate of attendance.
event.specialConditionsHTML:
Are you eligible for our support?

Eligibility criteria for attending this free course is:

  • The Enterprise must be based on Anglesey.
  • One delegate per enterprise can attend for free. Additional spaces will be charged at £30.00pp.
  • The Enterprise must be an SME which is defined as a micro, small and medium-sized enterprise employing fewer than 250 persons an and which has an annual turnover not exceeding EUR 50 million and/or an annual balance sheet total not exceeding EUR 43 million.

To meet our criteria you will need to complete our registration paperwork.

event.name: Mental Health First Aid
event.summaryHTML:
We offer training in Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) of which provides delegates with an understanding of mental health, the most common difficulties experienced and useful ‘first aid’ interventions.

The principles of mental health are explained and discussed with opportunity to practice essential ‘helping’ skills for use in the workplace, home and public places. These courses will build confidence and encourage skills to enable delegates to offer appropriate comfort and signposts to professional help.
event.descriptionHTML:
We offer training in Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) of which provides delegates with an understanding of mental health, the most common difficulties experienced and useful ‘first aid’ interventions. The principles of mental health are explained and discussed with opportunity to practice essential ‘helping’ skills for use in the workplace, home and public places.

These courses will build confidence and encourage skills to enable delegates to offer appropriate comfort and signposts to professional help.

Mental Health First Aid (endorsed) 2 days

This course is based on MHFA guidelines and covers:

• What is MHFA (Wales) and the stigma of mental illness.

• Recognising symptoms of depression and how to implement first aid for depression.

• Understanding anxiety, self harm and suicide and how to help.

• Symptoms of Psychosis and how to create action plans to assist with mental illness.

Training in Mind, MHFA (Wales) Certificate

event.name: Lunch and Tour at HMP Berwyn
event.summaryHTML: West Cheshire and North Wales Chamber of Commerce is delighted to announce we will be co-hosting a lunch and networking tour with HMP Berwyn.
event.descriptionHTML:
*Please note there is a maximum of 50 delegates allowed on this event. All guests will be required to provide identification in the form of a driving license or passport.*

In 2014, permission was granted for the North Wales Prison to be built in Wrexham. Berwyn was officially named on the 17th of February 2016, and opened on 27th of February 2017. Built on a former Firestone Tyre site on the Wrexham Industrial Estate, Berwyn is the largest prison in England and Wales and is the second largest prison in Europe.

Berwyn is a smoke-free closed rehabilitation establishment which holds 2,106 category C men. There are three houses.

Chamber networking events are a great way to broaden your business contacts, raise awareness of your company and network, all within a friendly and informal environment.

On the day, guests will be treated to a 2 Course Dinner Menu:

Menu TBA

Speaker TBA

In addition to the lunch there will be an opportunity to have a tour of this modern facility.

*Non-members can attend one event prior to joining, please note that this offer is not available to previous WCNW Chamber members*

event.name: Round the Table Networking at Palé Hall
event.summaryHTML: Join us for a breakfast Round-the-Table Networking at the beautiful Palé Hall Hotel.
event.descriptionHTML:
Palé Hall is an AA Five Red Star, Relais & Chateaux destination, luxury country house hotel with an acclaimed three rosette fine dining restaurant. Palé Hall is a destination for quiet retreat, comfort and culinary indulgence. Situated in the tranquil Dee valley this grand, historic, high Victorian mansion has an idyllic woodland garden rolling down to the banks of the river.

Guests will be provided with delicious breakfast favourites, alongside complimentary hot beverages, before taking part in our popular ’Round the Table’ networking. Round the Table networking events are a fun, lively and friendly way of getting to know fellow business people in the local community. Each guest has 2 minutes to introduce themselves and their business, before moving around the table and getting to know each delegate, before swapping business cards and moving onto another table.


We hope to see you there at what promises to be a fantastic event. Don’t forget to bring your business cards!

 *Non-Members can attend one Chamber event prior to joining, please note that this is not available to previous members of the Chamber*

event.summaryHTML: The role of team leader is both challenging and critical to the successful performance of a team. It is often an individual’s first steps into people management and the role can be the linchpin of many projects or organisational goals. With both established and aspiring team leaders in mind, this programme is designed to develop the knowledge of what makes a team effective and introduces skills and techniques to motivate a team effectively.
event.descriptionHTML:
The role of team leader is both challenging and critical to the successful performance of a team. It is often an individual’s first steps into people management and the role can be the linchpin of many projects or organisational goals. With both established and aspiring team leaders in mind, this programme is designed to develop the knowledge of what makes a team effective and introduces skills and techniques to motivate a team effectively.

The programme consists of four delivery days and key topics include establishing an effective team, organising work and motivating for performance and results.

Units include:

341 Leading and Motivating a Team Effectively

309 Understanding How to Establish an Effective Team

319 Understanding Organising and Delegating in the Workplace

event.name: ILM Level 5 People Manager
event.summaryHTML: This programme is essential for any middle or senior manager who is either completely new to managing people or who has found themselves with an expanding team of people to manage.
event.descriptionHTML:
This programme is essential for any middle or senior manager who is either completely new to managing people or who has found themselves with an expanding team of people to manage.

From human resource planning to individual performance and personal development plans, this award provides key skills, techniques and legal know how to allow managers to manage with confidence and carry out their role as People Manager effectively.

This programme includes a DiSC Management personality profile which will provide each delegate with a personalized report on their leadership style.

Content

Delivered over seven days this award will focus on recruitment, performance gap analysis and assessment, formal appraisals, planning individual development and evaluating the effectiveness of training.

Units Include:

514  Managing Recruitment

505  Managing Individual Development

event.name: Networking Fun with a Twist at Surf Snowdonia!
event.summaryHTML: Join us for a networking with a twist at Adventure Parc Snowdonia!
event.descriptionHTML:
Set in the midst of Snowdonia park, Adventure Parc Snowdonia combines the thrilling ocean sport with the beautiful Welsh landscape of Snowdonia, incorporating great fun with breathtaking natural beauty! Completely unique and unlike  anything you have ever experienced it certainly is not to be missed!

This event will give you the chance to experience Adventure Parc Snowdonia first hand with a FREE beginner surfing class! Unleash a talent you never knew you had!

If you would like to take part in the free surfing session please let us know when booking. Please also bring swimwear and a towel.

We hope to see you there, and remember –  don’t forget your business cards! 

*Non Members can attend one Chamber event prior to joining, please note that this offer is not applicable to previous members of the Chamber.*

event.name: Lunch and Networking at Oriel Hotel
event.summaryHTML: The Chamber of Commerce is delighted to invite you to join us at another superb lunch event, generously co-hosted by The Oriel Hotel
event.descriptionHTML:
The Oriel Hotel is a short stroll from the city of St. Asaph, located in the heart of North Wales, catering for large weddings and private functions to the highest standards. The Oriel Hotel is also the perfect place for that weekend getaway with its comfortable rooms, contemporary restaurant and relaxing spa. Ideally situated to explore the scenic North Wales countryside and Snowdonia.  

The stunning venue makes a perfect location for a Chamber networking lunch. These events give guests the opportunity to build the invaluable business relationships that SMEs need. Guests will have time to introduce themselves and their business to others in attendance before being seated for a two course lunch:
 
Menu TBA

A speaker from the region will also be speaking about their business journey and will be announced shortly!

We look forward to seeing you there.

*Non-members can attend one event prior to joining, please note that this offer is not available to previous WCNW Chamber members*

organiser.name: West Cheshire & North Wales Chamber of Commerce

event.name: Round the Table Breakfast at Conwy Business Centre
event.summaryHTML: The Chamber of Commerce is delighted to invite you to another superb networking event, generously co-hosted by Conwy Business Centre!
event.descriptionHTML:
The event is to be held at Conwy Business Centre, which focuses on business growth and development. The centre is a hub for local start-ups but also for existing businesses, helping them to thrive and grow within a modern and stylish environment. It is also a conference centre and a meeting place for seminars, workshops and training events.

Guests will be provided with delicious breakfast favourites, alongside complimentary hot beverages, before taking part in our popular ’round the table’ networking. Round the Table networking events are a fun, lively and friendly way of getting to know fellow business people in the local community.  Each guest has 2 minutes to introduce themselves and their business, before moving around the table and getting to know each delegate, before swapping business cards and moving onto another table.

We hope to see you there at what promises to be a fantastic event. Don’t forget to bring your business cards!

 *Non-Members can attend one Chamber event prior to joining, please note that this is not available to previous members of the Chamber*

organiser.name: West Cheshire & North Wales Chamber of Commerce

event.name: Networking Lunch at Venue in the Parc
event.summaryHTML: The WCNW Chamber of Commerce have teamed up with the Venue in the Park to host another fantastic Chamber networking lunch.
event.descriptionHTML:
The WCNW Chamber of Commerce have teamed up with the Venue in the Park to host another fantastic Chamber networking lunch.

Set in the beautiful surroundings of Alyn Waters County Park, Venue in the Park provides a perfect setting for a Chamber networking lunch! Chamber members Groundwork North Wales have recently taken over the management of the conference centre situated in 400 acres of woodland.

Chamber networking events are a great way to broaden your business contacts, raise awareness of your company and network, all within a friendly and informal environment.

Please note: Parking at the venue is £1 payable at the machine by the centre and cars can park down the side of the drive on the white stone.

event.summaryHTML: The Chamber of Commerce is delighted to invite you to join us at another superb lunch and networking event, generously co-hosted by The Quay Hotel and Spa.

Set on the idyllic Conwy Estuary, the 4-star Quay Hotel and Spa boasts awe-inspiring views of the beautiful scenery in North Wales and is located within easy reach of Snowdonia National Park, the neighbouring medieval town of Conwy and Victorian Llandudno.

The beautiful location makes a perfect venue for a Chamber networking event. These are a great way to broaden your business contacts, raise awareness of your company and network, all within a friendly and informal environment.
